name: Modules.Map.View
summary: Map view is used for embedding native mapping capabilities as a view in your application.

events.name: click
events.summary: Fired when the user selects or deselects an annotation, a polygon, a polyline or a circle.
events.description:
Note that the click event is not fired every time the user clicks on the map. It is fired in two circumstances:

  • The user clicks on the annotation. This will select the annotation.
  • The user deselects an annotation either by clicking on the map or another annotation.
  • The user clicks on a polygon, a polyline or a circle.

Note that only one annotation can be selected at any given time.

The click event includes a value, clicksource, which describes the part of the annotation that was clicked. The clicksource can be one of pin, infoWindow, leftButton or rightButton on iOS and pin, title, subtitle, leftPane, rightPane, infoWindow or null on Android. If the user deselects an annotation by clicking on the pin, clicksource is pin. If the user deselects the annotation by clicking elsewhere in the map view, clicksource is map.

For polygon, polyline or circle, The click event includes the following values. clicksource is a string describing the shape type. map is the map view instance. latitude and longtitude is the corresponding coordinates on the map where the user clicked in the shape.

properties.name: title
properties.summary: Title of the annotation.

properties.name: subtitle
properties.summary: Subtitle of the annotation.

properties.name: map
properties.summary: The map view instance.

properties.name: clicksource
properties.summary: Source of the click event. Can be one of pin, leftPane, rightPane, infoWindow or null. If it's a shape, it can be one of polygon, polyline, or circle. On Android, this also applies for title and subtitle.

properties.name: annotation
properties.summary: Annotation source object.

properties.name: latitude
properties.summary: Latitude of the clicked annotation or the point clicked in the polygon, polyline and circle.

properties.name: longitude
properties.summary: Longitude of the clicked annotation or the point clicked in the polygon, polyline and circle.

properties.name: deselected
properties.summary: Will show if the annotation was selected (false) or deselected (true)

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

events.name: longclick
events.summary: Fired when the user makes a long-press gesture on the map.
events.description:
A long press is generated by touching and holding on the touch screen.

The event occurs before the finger/button is lifted.

The longclick event returns longitude and latitude of the point on the ground that was pressed.

properties.name: latitude
properties.summary: latitude of the point on the ground that was pressed.

properties.name: longitude
properties.summary: longitude of the point on the ground that was pressed.

properties.name: map
properties.summary: The map view instance.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

events.name: clusterstart
events.summary: Fired when a collision between annotations occures.

properties.name: memberAnnotations
properties.summary: Array of annotations participating in clustering.

properties.name: map
properties.summary: This map view.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

events.name: onsnapshotready
events.summary: Fired when the snapshot is ready after snapshot is invoked.

properties.name: snapshot
properties.summary: snapshot of the current map

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

events.name: pinchangedragstate
events.summary: Fired when the user interacts with a draggable annotation.

properties.name: annotation
properties.summary: Annotation being dragged.

properties.name: map
properties.summary: This map view.

properties.name: title
properties.summary: Annotation title.

properties.name: newState
properties.summary: New drag state for the annotation, one of ANNOTATION_DRAG_STATE_NONE, ANNOTATION_DRAG_STATE_START, ANNOTATION_DRAG_STATE_DRAG, ANNOTATION_DRAG_STATE_CANCEL or ANNOTATION_DRAG_STATE_END.

properties.name: oldState
properties.summary: Previous drag state for the annotation, one of ANNOTATION_DRAG_STATE_NONE, ANNOTATION_DRAG_STATE_START, ANNOTATION_DRAG_STATE_DRAG, ANNOTATION_DRAG_STATE_CANCEL or ANNOTATION_DRAG_STATE_END.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

events.name: mapclick
events.summary: Fired when the user clicks on the map
events.description: The mapclick event is fired when the user clicks on the map and returns the longitude/latitude of that position.

properties.name: map
properties.summary: The map view instance.

properties.name: latitude
properties.summary: Latitude of the clicked position.

properties.name: longitude
properties.summary: Longitude of the clicked position.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

events.name: regionwillchange
events.summary: Fired when the mapping region will change.

properties.name: longitude
properties.summary: Longitude value for the center point of the map, in decimal degrees.

properties.name: latitude
properties.summary: Latitude value for the center point of the map, in decimal degrees.

properties.name: longitudeDelta
properties.summary: The amount of east-to-west distance displayed on the map, measured in decimal degrees.

properties.name: latitudeDelta
properties.summary: The amount of north-to-south distance displayed on the map, measured in decimal degrees.

properties.name: animated
properties.summary: The regionwillchange event was caused by an animation, such as a animating the camera.

properties.name: reason
properties.summary: The reason for the camera change, either REASON_API_ANIMATION, REASON_DEVELOPER_ANIMATION or REASON_GESTURE.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

events.name: regionchanged
events.summary: Fired when the mapping region finished changing.

properties.name: longitude
properties.summary: Longitude value for the center point of the map, in decimal degrees.

properties.name: latitude
properties.summary: Latitude value for the center point of the map, in decimal degrees.

properties.name: longitudeDelta
properties.summary: The amount of east-to-west distance displayed on the map, measured in decimal degrees.

properties.name: latitudeDelta
properties.summary: The amount of north-to-south distance displayed on the map, measured in decimal degrees.

properties.name: animated
properties.summary: The regionchanged event was caused by an animation, such as a animating the camera.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

events.name: userLocation
events.summary: Fired when the user changes on the map.
events.description: When the user location is available or changes at the map it will fire the event.

properties.name: latitude
properties.summary: latitude of the point on the ground that was pressed.

properties.name: longitude
properties.summary: longitude of the point on the ground that was pressed.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

methods.name: addAnnotation
methods.summary: Adds a new annotation to the map.

methods.name: addAnnotations
methods.summary: Adds one or more new annotations to the map.

methods.name: addCircle
methods.summary: Adds a new circle to the map.

methods.name: addCircles
methods.summary: Adds one or more new circles to the map.

methods.name: addHeatmap
methods.summary: Adds a heatmap to the map.
methods.description: A heatmap is defined by an array of coordinates.

methods.name: addImageOverlay
methods.summary: Adds a new image overlay to the map.

methods.name: addImageOverlays
methods.summary: Adds one or more new image overlays to the map.

methods.name: addPolygon
methods.summary: Adds a new polygon to the map.

methods.name: addPolygons
methods.summary: Adds one or more new polygons to the map.

methods.name: addPolyline
methods.summary: Adds a new polylines to the map.

methods.name: addPolylines
methods.summary: Adds one or more new polylines to the map.

methods.name: addRoute
methods.summary: Adds a route to the map.

methods.name: animateCamera
methods.summary: Changes the camera used for determining the map's viewing parameters and animates the change.

parameters.name: animationParams
parameters.summary: Properties for controlling the camera animation. The property camera is required.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.summary: A method that will be called when the camera animation completes. Optionally, the completion of camera animations can be captured by listening for a regionchanged event with animated set to true.

methods.name: containsCoordinate
methods.summary: Validated whether or not a given coordinate is currently visible in the map rect.

parameters.name: coordinate
parameters.summary: The latitude and longitude pair represented by an Object.

returns.summary: Returns true if given coordinate is within the displayed map view.

methods.name: deselectAnnotation
methods.summary: Deselects the specified annotation, so the main annotation is hidden and only a pin image is shown.

parameters.name: annotation
parameters.summary: Annotation to deselect, identified by an annotation title or a Modules.Map.Annotation reference.

methods.name: removeAllAnnotations
methods.summary: Removes all annotations from the map.

methods.name: removeAllCircles
methods.summary: Remove all circles from the map.

methods.name: removeAllImageOverlays
methods.summary: Remove all image overlays from the map.

methods.name: removeAllPolygons
methods.summary: Remove all polygons from the map.

methods.name: removeAllPolylines
methods.summary: Remove all polylines from the map.

methods.name: removeAnnotation
methods.summary: Removes an existing annotation from the map.

parameters.name: annotation
parameters.summary: Annotation to remove, identified by an annotation title or a Modules.Map.Annotation reference.

methods.name: removeAnnotations
methods.summary: Removes one or more existing annotations from the map.
methods.description: Annotations can be identified by title or by a Modules.Map.Annotation reference.

methods.name: removeCircle
methods.summary: Remove a circle from the map.

methods.name: removeImageOverlay
methods.summary: Remove an image overlay from the map.

methods.name: removePolygon
methods.summary: Remove a polygon from the map.

methods.name: removePolyline
methods.summary: Remove a polyline from the map.

methods.name: removeRoute
methods.summary: Remove a previously added route.

methods.name: selectAnnotation
methods.summary: Selects the annotation, showing the full annotation.

parameters.name: annotation
parameters.summary: Annotation to show, identified by an annotation title or a Modules.Map.Annotation reference.

methods.name: setClusterAnnotation
methods.summary: Set new cluster annotation for the clustered annotation.
methods.description: This method should be called inside the clusterstart event. See the example "Map Example With Marker Annotation and Clustering".

methods.name: setLocation
methods.summary: Sets the map location and zoom level.
methods.description:
The location is set using a simple dictionary object, described in MapLocationTypeV2. If latitudeDelta and longitudeDelta are set, these specified parameters bound the area of interest, which is centered and displayed at the greatest possible zoom level. This method can only be called after the map completes loading. Before that, use region to set the map location. For example:

myMapView.setLocation({
  latitude: 37.337681,
  longitude: -122.038193,
  animate: true,
  latitudeDelta: 0.04,
  longitudeDelta: 0.04
});

parameters.name: location
parameters.summary: Dictionary specifying the location and the zoom level for the map.

methods.name: setMapType
methods.summary: Sets the type of map (satellite, normal, or terrain).

methods.name: showAnnotations
methods.summary: Sets the visible region so that the map displays the specified annotations. If no array is passed annotations on the map will be shown. The default padding of 20px is applied and can be changed by using the padding property.

methods.name: snapshot
methods.summary: Takes a snapshot of the map
methods.description: Takes a snapshot of the current map and returns the image via onsnapshotready event.

methods.name: zoom
methods.summary: Zooms in or out of the map.
methods.description:
Zooms in or out by specifying a relative zoom level. A positive value increases the current zoom level and a negative value decreases the zoom level.

Each increase in zoom level increases the magnification by a factor of two.

parameters.name: level
parameters.summary: Relative zoom level (positive to zoom in, negative to zoom out).

properties.name: animate
properties.summary: Indicates if changes to the mapping region should be animated.
properties.description: Setting this to 'false' will not stop the animation from clicking the My Location button, since that is native Android behavior.

properties.name: annotations
properties.summary: An array of annotations to add to the map.
properties.description: There is no guarantee that the order of elements in the annotations property will be maintained when creating, adding or deleting annotations from the Ti.Map.View object. If the application depends on the annotations being in a set order, it should keep references to all of the annotations in a separate array.

properties.name: camera
properties.summary: The camera used for determining the appearance of the map.
properties.description:
A camera object defines a point above the map's surface from which to view the map. Applying a camera to a map has the effect of giving the map a 3D-like appearance. You can use a camera to rotate the map so that it is oriented to match the user's heading or to apply a pitch angle to tilt the plane of the map.

Assigning a new camera to this property updates the map immediately and without animating the change. If you want to animate changes in camera position, use the animateCamera method instead.

You must not set this property to null. To restore the map to a flat appearance, apply a camera with a pitch angle of 0, which yields a camera looking straight down onto the map surface.

properties.name: compassEnabled
properties.summary: Enable or disables the compass button.

properties.name: enableZoomControls
properties.summary: Enables or disables the built-in zoom controls.
properties.description: If enabled, the zoom controls are a pair of buttons (one for zooming in, one for zooming out) that appear on the screen. When pressed, they cause the camera to zoom in (or out) by one zoom level. If disabled, the zoom controls are not shown.

properties.name: indoorEnabled
properties.summary: A Boolean value indicating whether the indoor mapping is enabled.
properties.description: This property is used to enabled/disable the indoor mapping feature of Google Maps. Changing the value after the MapView is drawn can cause flickering. You can read more at: Google Indoor Maps

properties.name: liteMode
properties.summary: Create a liteMode map version
properties.description: When the liteMode is switched on the map will be displayed as a bitmap with limited interaction. Please refer to Google developers documentation for more details.

properties.name: mapToolbarEnabled
properties.summary: Enable or disables the map toolbar.

properties.name: mapType
properties.summary: Map type constant, either NORMAL_TYPE, SATELLITE_TYPE, TERRAIN_TYPE, HYBRID_TYPE, HYBRID_FLYOVER_TYPE or SATELLITE_FLYOVER_TYPE.

properties.name: maxZoomLevel
properties.summary: Returns the maximum zoom level available at the current camera position.
properties.description:
Returns the maximum zoom level for the current camera position. This takes into account what map type is currently being used. For example, satellite or terrain may have a lower max zoom level than the base map tiles.

This will only give the correct value after the 'complete' event is fired.

properties.name: minClusterSize
properties.summary: Sets the minium size of a cluster.
properties.description: The minium cluster size is the smallest number of annotations that are merged together and (minClusterSize + 1) is the smallest number that will appear on the cluster.

properties.name: minZoomLevel
properties.summary: Returns the minimum zoom level available at the current camera position.
properties.description:
Returns the minimum zoom level. This is the same for every location (unlike the maximum zoom level) but may vary between devices and map sizes.

This will only give the correct value after the 'complete' event is fired.

properties.name: padding
properties.summary: Sets the distance between each edges of the view to the map controls.
properties.description: The map view controls may be obscured by other elements.

properties.name: pitchEnabled
properties.summary: A Boolean value indicating whether the map camera's pitch information is used.
properties.description: When this property is set to true and a valid camera is associated with the map, the camera's pitch angle is used to tilt the plane of the map. When this property is set to false, the camera's pitch angle is ignored and the map is always displayed as if the user is looking straight down onto it.

properties.name: region
properties.summary: A dictionary specifying the location and zoom level of the map.

properties.name: rotateEnabled
properties.summary: A Boolean value indicating whether the map camera's heading information is used.
properties.description: When this property is set to true and a valid camera is associated with the map, the camera's heading angle is used to rotate the plane of the map around its center point. When this property is set to false, the camera's heading angle is ignored and the map is always oriented so that true north is situated at the top of the map view.

properties.name: scrollEnabled
properties.summary: A Boolean value indicating whether the map can be scrolled by dragging gesture.
properties.description: When this property is set to true the a map view can be panned or scrolled by dragging the map view.

properties.name: showsBuildings
properties.summary: A Boolean indicating whether the map displays extruded building information.
properties.description: When this property is set to true and the camera has a pitch angle greater than zero, the map extrudes buildings so that they extend above the map plane, creating a 3D effect. The mapType property must be set to NORMAL_TYPE for extruded buildings to be displayed.

properties.name: showsCompass
properties.summary: A Boolean indicating whether the map displays a compass control.
properties.description: When this property is set to true, the map displays the control that lets users change the heading orientation of the map.

properties.name: showsPointsOfInterest
properties.summary: A Boolean indicating whether the map displays point-of-interest information.
properties.description: When this property is set to true, the map displays icons and labels for restaurants, schools, and other relevant points of interest.

properties.name: showsScale
properties.summary: A Boolean indicating whether the map shows scale information.
properties.description: When this property is set to true, the map displays the scale information.

properties.name: showsTraffic
properties.summary: A Boolean value indicating whether the map displays traffic information.
properties.description: The mapType property must be set to NORMAL_TYPE or HYBRID_TYPE for traffic information to be shown.

properties.name: style
properties.summary: JSON String to style the Map.
properties.description: This property will change the look (colors, roads, labels) of the map. A valid JSON can be created at Google Maps Styling Wizard

properties.name: traffic
properties.summary: Toggles the traffic layer on or off.
properties.description: Set to true to display the traffic layer or false to hide it. This is subject to the availability of traffic data.

properties.name: userLocation
properties.summary: Boolean indicating if the user's current device location should be shown on the map.
properties.description: If true, the user's location is marked with a pin, and the My Location button will appear in the top right corner of the screen. Starting in iOS 8, permissions must be added to tiapp.xml. Details in description.

properties.name: userLocationButton
properties.summary: Enable or disables the My Location button. If the button is enabled, it is only shown when userLocation is enabled.
properties.description: If true, the My Location button is enabled.

properties.name: zoom
properties.summary: Returns the current zoom level from the current camera position.
properties.description: Returns the current zoom level from the current camera position. Note: This will only return the correct value once the complete event is fired.

properties.name: zoomEnabled
properties.summary: A Boolean value indicating whether the map can be zoomed by pinching or tapping.
properties.description: When this property is set to true the a map view can be zoomed by pinching inwards to zoom out and reverse to zoom in. Zooming in can also be accoplished by double-tapping the map view. Zooming out can also be accomplished by two-finger tapping the map view.

properties.name: zOrderOnTop
properties.summary: Controls wether the map view's surface is placed on top of its window.
properties.description: Please refer to zOrderOnTop for more details.
